article:
My father was a hard-working man who delivered bread as a living to support my family. He spent all his evenings after work having classes, hoping to   _   himself so that he could find a better job. Except for Sundays, Father   _   ate a meal together with us. 
Whenever the family complained that he wasn't spending enough time with us, his   _   was that he was doing all this for us. 
The day came when the examination results were announced. To his joy, Father passed! Soon he was offered a good job with high pay. Father could now   _   to provide my family with nice clothing and fine food.
However, the family   _   did not see Father for most of the week. He   _   to work very hard, hoping to be promoted  . He took another   _   in the Open University so as to get more chances of being promoted.
Father's hard work paid off and he was promoted. He decided to hire a servant to do housework. He also   _   that our three-room house was not big enough and it would be wonderful for my family to   _   a comfortable house. Having experienced the   _   of his hard work many times before, Father decided to continue his   _   and work for being promoted again.
As expected, Father's hard work   paid off   again and he bought a beautiful villa  . On the first Sunday at our new   _  , Father   _   not to take courses or expect any more promotions. He would   _   more time to our family. But Father did not wake up the next day.
